conclusion: Understanding the relationship between the light source, objects, and shadows.
Shadow A is cast by the cake with the light source in front, shadow is to the right.
Shadow B is cast by the pen with the light source in front, shadow is to the right.
Shadow C is cast by the roll of paper with the red cross with the light source in front, shadow is to the right.
Shadow D is cast by the ring with the light source in front, shadow is to the right.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadows will be cast in the opposite direction.
New Shadow A will be cast to the left of the cake.
New Shadow B will be cast to the left of the pen.
New Shadow C will be cast to the left of the roll of paper.
New Shadow D will be cast to the left of the ring.
The size of shadows depends on the distance of objects from the light source and surface.
Shadow A will move to the left and possibly become smaller.
Shadow B will move to the left and possibly become smaller.
Shadow C will move to the left and possibly become smaller.
Shadow D will move to the left and possibly become smaller.
Exact positions and sizes depend on specific distances and angles.
